comments:
In order for help browser window to be always available, not affected by 
modality of other Eclipse window, I am creating a second Thread, display and 
shell.  Everything runs without problems, but org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser 
widget.

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2651)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2555)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:114)
	at 
org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.browser.embedded.EmbeddedBrowser.createShell
(EmbeddedBrowser.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.browser.embedded.EmbeddedBrowser.<init>
(EmbeddedBrowser.java:56)
	at 
org.eclipse.help.ui.internal.browser.embedded.EmbeddedBrowserAdapter$1.run
(EmbeddedBrowserAdapter.java:79)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

This is an OLE problem. OLE has to be made apartment threaded. Assigning to 
Veronika.
*** Bug 65407 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 67543 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Could you please change the priority from P3 to P2. Thanks.

Fixed in 3.1 HEAD > Oct 6, 2004.

Note that this fix only applies to Windows.  The browser can not be created in 
a second thread on any other platform.
